scenario_1.persona_content: A healthcare professional who is interested in the latest research and treatments for shingles, as well as the potential for a vaccine to prevent the disease. They are also interested in the symptoms, causes, and complications of shingles, and the best ways to manage the pain and reduce the risk of lasting nerve damage.
scenario_1.thought: As a healthcare professional, I believe in fairness and equitable distribution whenever possible. While receiving 600 is tempting, the right option ensures both Person A and I receive 400. This promotes a sense of equality, which aligns with my values. Therefore, I choose the right option, even though it means receiving less individually.

scenario_2.persona_content: A healthcare professional who is interested in the latest research and treatments for shingles, as well as the potential for a vaccine to prevent the disease. scenario_2.thought: As a healthcare professional, I'm always evaluating risk and reward. I prioritize maximizing resources when possible, so I'll choose the option where I receive more. Therefore, I will choose Right.

scenario_3.persona_content: A healthcare professional who is interested in the latest research and treatments for shingles, as well as the potential for a vaccine to prevent the disease. They are also interested in the symptoms, causes, and complications of shingles, and the best ways to manage the pain and reduce the risk of lasting nerve damage.
scenario_3.thought: As a healthcare professional, I often consider the well-being of others. While option Right gives me a higher payout (300 vs 200), it significantly reduces Person A's payout (100 vs 200). Option Left provides a more equitable distribution, with both Person A and Person B receiving 200. I value fairness in this scenario, so I will choose the option that benefits both individuals more equally. Therefore, I choose Left.
